_header: Hail be thou Mary Christs mother dear
_description: A salutation of the Virgin Mary — five monorhyming quatrains

Lam853.First Lines:
HEil be þou marie cristis moder dereþat art queene of
                    heuen fair and sweet of chereÞat art sterre of heuen schynynge
                    briȝt & clereHelpe me lady ful of myȝt & heere my preiere
                    Aue maria…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Heil be þou marie gloriouse moder hendeMeeknes &
                    honeste with abstynence me sendWith chastite & charite into my lyues
                    eendeAnd þat þoruȝ þi preier lady I mote to heuen blis
                    weendeAue maria
Lam853.Note:
The line length does not fit this format, with one verse line spreading
                    out over more than one manuscript line.
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 6-7.
Watts,  Nevile. 
             Love Songs of Sion.
         New York: Benziger, 1924: 136 (mod.).
